metadata.update_reason: Removed requirements, added domain knowledge and relationships

Project.name: PowerPay
Project.description: Zephrins Bakeries located in Barbados asked Keyanola Innovations to produce a Payroll software package to match the  company requirements for both monthly and weekly payroll.  In addition, a second company, River Bay Trading, asked Keyanola to develop a piecework payroll primarily for use in the manufacturing industry where employees are paid based on what their produce and not the time spent on the job.

Feature.name: User Authentication
Feature.description: System should support a login feature that will allow authorized users to access features of the system.

Feature.name: Weekly Payroll
Feature.description: Payroll should facilitate payment of weekly paid workers

Feature.name: Monthly Payroll
Feature.description: Payroll should facilitate payment of monthly paid workers

Feature.name: Piecework Payroll
Feature.description: Payroll should facilitate payment of piecework paid workers

Feature.name: Employee Statuary Deductions
Feature.description: Tax and NIS Government deductions

Feature.name: Employee General Deductions
Feature.description: Deductions sent to Stores, Courts and other Employee Debtors

Feature.name: Employee Allowances
Feature.description: Provision allowances

Feature.name: Staff Loans
Feature.description: Makes procvision for staff loans

Feature.name: Extra Time and Vacation Pay
Feature.description: Tracks overtime, shifts, and leave.

Feature.name: Attendance & Time Integration
Feature.description: Inferfaces with standard time and attendance systems

Feature.name: Employee Information Management
Feature.description: Employee profiles (name, contact, job role, department).

Feature.name: Salary Calculation
Feature.description: Automates gross pay, deductions, and net pay.

Feature.name: Electronic Payment
Feature.description: Direct Deposit / Bank Transfers

Feature.name: Compliance and Legal Reporting
Feature.description: Generates reports required by labor laws, social security agencies, or tax authorities.

Feature.name: Integration Accounting Systems
Feature.description: Send summarized or detailed transactions to General Ledger software

Feature.name: Self-Service Portal
Feature.description: Employees can view/download payslips, update personal details, and check leave balances.

Feature.name: Audit Trails & Security
Feature.description: Tracks who made changes to payroll data.

Feature.name: Analytics & Dashboards
Feature.description: For example cost per department

Feature.name: Automated Reminders
Feature.description: Payroll deadlines, compliance filings

Feature.name: Customizable Pay Structures
Feature.description: Ability to add different types of allowances and deduciions

Risk.description: Frequent changes in legislation (tax rates, NIS/NSSF, health surcharges, levy changes, etc.) → software may become non-compliant if updates lag.
Risk.Mitigation: Build configurable tax/deduction engine, monitor BRA & NIS updates regularly.

Risk.description: Integration with local banks and the unpredictable  interface changes
Risk.Mitigation: Provide flexible export formats (CSV/TXT/XML), partner with banks for specs.
Enforce encryption (at rest/in transit), audit logs and access controls
Provide training, intuitive UI, and self-service features.
Ensure long-term support agreements, possible partnerships with established IT firms.

Constraint.description: The system must comply with local tax laws (e.g., PAYE, NIS, Social Security, Medicare, pension deductions).
Compliance with minimum wage, overtime, leave entitlements, and working hours regulations.
Payroll involves sensitive employee information, so the system must follow privacy laws
Records must be stored and retrievable for statutory audits and reporting
System must handle increasing employee numbers without performance degradation.
Data in transit and at rest must be protected
Internal controls must prevent unauthorized salary changes, ghost employees, or duplicate payments.
Backups and redundancy are required to ensure payroll continuity in case of failures.

Qual_Scenario.name: Fast Payroll Run
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Requests monthly payroll processing for all employees
Qual_Scenario.environment: End of month, week high load (100 + employees)
Qual_Scenario.response: System calculates salaries, deductions, and generates pay slips

Qual_Scenario.name: Unauthorized Salary Change Attempt
Qual_Scenario.artefact: Payroll database and access control system
Qual_Scenario.response_measure: 100% of unauthorized attempts blocked, audit trail recorded

Qual_Scenario.name: Tax Rule Update
Qual_Scenario.response: Admin updates configuration without code changes
Qual_Scenario.response_measure: Updates applied in <2 hours, new calculations verified

Qual_Scenario.name: Payroll History Request
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Requests audit report for employee payroll history
Qual_Scenario.response_measure: Report available within 2 minutes, covering all changes

Qual_Scenario.name: Concurrent Salary Update Handling
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Two admins try to update the same employee’s salary simultaneously
Qual_Scenario.response: System handles concurrency and ensures only one valid update is applied
Qual_Scenario.response_measure: No data corruption, updates resolved within 2 seconds

Qual_Scenario.name: Employee Bank Detail Validation
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Employee enters incorrect bank account format
Qual_Scenario.response: System rejects input with a clear error message

Qual_Scenario.name: Scalable Payroll Expansion
Qual_Scenario.response: System processes expanded payroll without redesign

Qual_Scenario.name: Data Privacy Access Request
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Requests access to their personal payroll data
Qual_Scenario.response: System provides employee’s payroll data only to them

Qual_Scenario.name: Automated Backup During Payroll Run
Qual_Scenario.stimulus: Nightly scheduled backup occurs during payroll batch processing

Decision.description: modular/microservices architecture - separate services for payroll processing, reporting, authentication etc.
